messages.content: What is the primary environmental benefit associated with electric cars?
The primary environmental benefit associated with electric cars is the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions and other pollutants, as they produce zero tailpipe emissions.
What types of electric transportation are mentioned in the article as being covered by the broader term 'Electric vehicle'?
The article mentions that the term 'Electric vehicle' covers all types of electric transportation, not just electric automobiles.
What type of automobile is propelled by an electric traction motor, using electrical energy as the primary source of propulsion?
An electric car or electric vehicle (EV) is a passenger automobile that is propelled by an electric traction motor, using electrical energy as the primary source of propulsion.
What types of vehicles are broadly included under the term electric car, apart from battery electric vehicles?
The term electric car may also include plug-in hybrid electric vehicles (PHEV), range-extended electric vehicles (REEV), and fuel cell electric vehicles (FCEV).
What percentage of new car sales were plug-in electric cars in 2022?
14% of new car sales were plug-in electric cars in 2022.
What type of electric vehicle is typically referred to as an 'electric car'?
A battery electric vehicle (BEV) or all-electric car, which has an onboard rechargeable battery pack that can be plugged in and charged from the electric grid.
What is the name of the first electric car, often credited to Robert Anderson, and in what time period was it invented?
The first electric car is often credited to Robert Anderson, and it was invented sometime between 1832 and 1839.
What was the primary advantage of electric vehicles over gasoline-powered ones in the early 20th century?
Electric vehicles were quieter than gasoline-powered ones and did not require gear changes.
What was the decisive moment that contributed to the decline of electric cars in popularity?
The introduction in 1912 of the electric starter motor, which replaced laborious methods of starting internal-combustion engine cars such as hand-cranking.
What was the year that California Air Resources Board (CARB) began a push for more fuel-efficient, lower-emissions vehicles?
The California Air Resources Board (CARB) began a push for more fuel-efficient, lower-emissions vehicles in the early 1990s.
